'''Iain Glen''' (born 24 June 1961) is a Scottish actor. He stars in [[HBO]]'s ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' as Ser [[Jorah Mormont]]. He was announced in the role on 20 August 2009. He was part of the initial starring cast and remains a member of the starring cast for the [[Season 2|second season]].

He is arguably best known for his role as the villain in the film ''[[wikipedia:Lara Croft: Tomb Raider|Lara Croft: Tomb Raider]]'' and a multi-award-winning performance as [[wikipedia:Larry Winters|Larry Winters]] in ''[[wikipedia:Silent Scream (1990 film)|Silent Scream]]''. He also had a cameo as King [[wikipedia:Richard the Lionheart|Richard the Lionheart]] in ''[[wikipedia:Kingdom of Heaven (film)|Kingdom of Heaven]]''. He is also known for his role as Prince Hamlet in the 1990 film adaptation of Tom Stoppard's play ''[[wikipedia:Rosencrantz_and_Guildenstern_are_Dead_(film)|Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead]]''.

He had a supporting role as Octavian in "Flesh and Stone" and "The Time of Angels" of the 2010 season of ''[[wikipedia:Doctor Who|Doctor Who]]''. In 2011, he was cast in a recurring role in Downton Abbey as Sir Richard Carlisle, a newspaper mogul and suitor to Lady Mary Crawley. In 2012 he began a starring role in the BBC drama ''[[wikipedia:Prisoner's Wives|Prisoner's Wives]]'' as Paul, a convicted drug trafficker. He also stars in the title role in the TV3 miniseriesÂ [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Taylor_(TV_series) Jack Taylor] .
